org.openimaj.ml.clustering

Interface SpatialClusterer<CLUSTERTYPE extends SpatialClusters<DATATYPE>,DATATYPE>

  • Type Parameters:
    CLUSTERTYPE - The type of cluster produced.
    DATATYPE - the primitive array datatype which represents a centroid of this cluster.
    All Superinterfaces:
    Clusterer<DATATYPE[]>
    All Known Implementing Classes:
    ByteKMeans, ClusterLimitedIntRAC, DoubleKDTreeClusterer, DoubleKMeans, DoubleNNDBSCAN, FeatureVectorKMeans, FloatKMeans, HierarchicalByteKMeans, HierarchicalDoubleKMeans, HierarchicalFloatKMeans, HierarchicalIntKMeans, HierarchicalLongKMeans, HierarchicalShortKMeans, IntKMeans, IntRAC, IntRandomForest, LongKMeans, RandomByteClusterer, RandomDoubleClusterer, RandomFloatClusterer, RandomIntClusterer, RandomLongClusterer, RandomSetByteClusterer, RandomSetDoubleClusterer, RandomSetFloatClusterer, RandomSetIntClusterer, RandomSetLongClusterer, RandomSetShortClusterer, RandomShortClusterer, ShortKMeans, SphericalKMeans

    public interface SpatialClusterer<CLUSTERTYPE extends SpatialClusters<DATATYPE>,DATATYPE>
extends Clusterer<DATATYPE[]>
    A SpatialClusterer clusters data that can be represented as points in a space. Each point is typically represented by a numerical coordinate vector.
    Author:
    Jonathon Hare (jsh2@ecs.soton.ac.uk), Sina Samangooei (ss@ecs.soton.ac.uk)

      • cluster

        CLUSTERTYPE cluster(DataSource<DATATYPE> data)
        Perform clustering with data from a data source. The DataSource could potentially be backed by disk rather in memory.
        Parameters:
        data - the data.
        Returns:
        the generated clusters.
